title: Ibstone Walks

images.title: Graham Horn / Towards Cobstone Mill
images.caption: Towards Cobstone Mill. A footpath climbs Turville Hill, from the village of the same name, towards Cobstone Mill. This stock mill is in private ownership, with no public access, and it is seen more clearly from afar anyway. It is famous as being one of the main locations in the film Chitty Chitty Bang Bang, as well as other films and TV series.

images.title: Hugh Chevallier / The Wormsley Estate
images.caption: The Wormsley Estate. Wormsley is a private estate of Mark Getty and his family, set in 2,700-acre (1,100 ha). Acquired by Sir Paul Getty in 1985, the estate forms part of Hambleden valley, running from Stokenchurch to Turville. Wormsley is known for its library, its cricket ground, its two-acre walled garden, its shoot, and the vistas and landscapes of the estate grounds. It also rents space for events and television and filming work.

images.title: Steve Daniels / Woods at the Aston Rowant Nature Reserve
images.caption: Woods at the Aston Rowant Nature Reserve

images.title: Welcome to the Talking Trail by Des Blenkinsopp, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Welcome to the Talking Trail at Aston Rowant

images.title: Andrew Smith / Cottages, pasture and woodland below Stokenchurch
images.caption: Cottages, pasture and woodland below Stokenchurch. The cottages are one of two pairs of semis on the estate road north of Wellground Farm. They are viewed from the bridleway that climbs through woodland to the east. The scenery is typical Chiltern mix of woodland and pasture, valleys and ridges.

images.title: Red kite over Aston Rowant National Nature Reserve by David Hawgood, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Red kite over Aston Rowant National Nature Reserve

description: This Buckinghamshire based village is located in a pleasant rural spot in the Chiltern Hills, on the border with Oxfordshire. The neighbouring village of Stokenchurch lies just a few miles to the north. This walk from the village takes you north to visit the Aston Rowant Nature Reserve and climb to the viewpoint at Beacon Hill in the Chilterns. On the way you will pass along the old Wormsley Estate and visit Ibstone Common. There's lots of peaceful woodland trails, countryside paths, wildlife and some excellent views from the high points. The Wormsley Estate is private but is open on certain days for special events. It is well known for its cricket ground and a good place to look out for red kites. Public footpaths skirts the eastern edge of the estate. To continue your walking around the village head south to nearby Turville where you can pay a visit to the famous Chitty Chitty Bang Bang Windmill .
